title: Stability Testing of New Drug Substances and Products
purpose: Defines stability testing requirements to ensure drug quality over its shelf life.
for_beginners: Explains how long medicines stay safe and effective under different temperatures and conditions.

title: Validation of Analytical Procedures
purpose: Outlines how to validate lab methods used to test medicines.
used_for: Validation of assay, dissolution, identity, impurity tests.
for_beginners: Shows how to prove that lab methods give correct and reliable results.

title: Structure and Content of Clinical Study Reports
purpose: Specifies the format and content of clinical study reports for regulatory submissions.
used_for: Creating standardized clinical trial reports for NDA/ANDA submissions.
for_beginners: Explains how to write and organize results of human studies on new drugs.

title: Good Clinical Practice (GCP)
purpose: Defines the ethical and scientific quality standards for designing, conducting, and reporting clinical trials.
used_for: Compliance with clinical trial standards and patient safety.
for_beginners: Tells how clinical trials must be done ethically and safely to protect human volunteers.

title: General Considerations for Clinical Studies
purpose: Provides overall principles for conducting clinical trials.
used_for: Designing ethical, scientifically sound clinical trials.
for_beginners: Guides how to plan and manage medicine testing on people responsibly.

title: Statistical Principles for Clinical Trials
purpose: Covers statistical methods used in designing, analyzing and interpreting clinical trials.
used_for: Choosing sample sizes, evaluating significance of clinical trial results.
for_beginners: Explains how to use statistics to prove if a medicine really works.

title: General Principles for Planning and Design of Multi-Regional Clinical Trials
purpose: Promotes harmonization of global clinical trials across multiple regions.
used_for: Running the same clinical trial in multiple countries for faster global approval.
for_beginners: Helps companies test one medicine in many countries at once.

title: Common Technical Document (CTD)
purpose: Standardizes the format of regulatory submissions across regions.
used_for: Creating unified dossiers for regulatory agencies.
for_beginners: Tells how to organize documents for medicine approval the same way everywhere.

title: Electronic Common Technical Document (eCTD)
purpose: Describes how to submit CTD documents electronically to regulatory agencies.
used_for: eCTD structure, file naming, bookmarks, hyperlinks.
for_beginners: Explains how to send your medicine documents online in the correct format.

title: Bioequivalence for Immediate-Release Solid Oral Dosage Forms
purpose: Provides harmonized guidance on conducting bioequivalence studies for generic drugs.
used_for: Generic drug approval, demonstrating equivalence to reference product.
for_beginners: Helps prove that your generic tablet works the same as the original brand.
